appearance: Usually oblong, silvery surface streaks which are open in the shape of a U counter to the direction of flow. The material pumped out of the cylinder is foamed and shows blisters on the surface.
cause: Moisture content too high; water vapor produced during melting results in surface of molding being torn open.
correction:
1.Material is adequately predried to residual moisture content of < 0.1 %
2.Increase back pressure.

picture.caption: Fig. 1.1.1: Streaks due to an excessively high moisture content in the granules
Fig. 1.1.2: Section through a tom streak, transmitted light,  magnification 80: 7
